title: Pontsticill Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: RAY JONES / Pontsticill Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pontsticill Reservoir Valve house

images.title: Stuart Wilding / Pontsticill Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pontsticill Reservoir. The reservoir was completed in 1927 and includes the Merthyr Tydfil sailing club on the eastern side.

images.title: Stuart Wilding / The dam at Pontsticill Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The dam at Pontsticill Reservoir

images.title: Mike Baldwin / Pontsticill Reservoir and Pen y Fan, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View north from road across Pontsticill reservoir. Pen y Fan is the angular peak in the centre of the photograph.

images.title: Gareth James / Between the Reservoirs
images.caption: Between the Reservoirs. Road to Dol-y-Gaer (behind), between the Pontsticill (or Taf Fechan) reservoir (left), and Pentwyn (or Dol-y-Gaer) Reservoir (right).

images.title: Converted chapel near Dol-y-gaer by Gareth James, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Converted chapel near Dol-y-gaer. This rather photogenic structure is located at the northern end of the lake.

images.title: Pentwyn Reservoir by Robin Drayton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pentwyn Reservoir. This is a view of the southern end of Pentwyn Reservoir which joins Pontsticill at the northern end.

images.title: Gareth James / Forest track beside Brecon Mountain Railway
images.caption: Forest track beside Brecon Mountain Railway. This is on the eastern side of the lake where you can enjoy views of the old tourist trains.

description: This circular walk takes you around the beautiful Pontsticill Reservoir in the Brecon Beacons National Park. The reservoir is located a few miles north of Merthyr Tydfil on the Taff Trail. You can catch the splendid Brecon Mountain Railway to Pontsticill station next to the reservoir. The railway runs from Pant near Merthyr Tydfil along the full length of the Pontsticill Reservoir to Torpantau high in the Brecon Beacons. The walk starts near the Dam and Pontsticill station and heads along the Taff Trail through a woodland area on the western side of the reservoir. You return on the eastern side, climbing towards Cwm Criban for splendid views of Pontsticill and the surrounding countryside. You then descend towards the dam and the finish point. The route runs for just under 7 miles and includes a moderate climb on the way. You can extend the walk by continuing around Pentwyn Reservoir which lies just to the north.
